alert.note: Alert for Muskogee; Okmulgee; Wagoner; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:42AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Rogers, south central Washington, western Wagoner, northeastern Okmulgee, northwestern Muskogee and eastern Tulsa Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 342 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Vera to 3 miles north of Broken Arrow to Okmulgee. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Claremore... Okmulgee... Owasso... Bixby... Jenks... Coweta... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... Haskell... Inola... Morris... Oologah... Boynton... Vera... Preston... Stonebluff... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 224 and 253. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
